ygData.subject: FW: [shadowknight] [corpse retrieval]
ygData.msgSnippet: (Setting macros for anyone interested: Select the start F10 view, select ... new ... for ... From: Steve Tountas [mailto:tountass@idol.union.edu] Sent:
ygData.messageBody:
(Setting macros for anyone interested: Select the start F10 view, select
> "Social Skills" from Lower right panel. decide on one to do away with and
> right click on it. The dialog section will display a text box to enter the
> Button Caption and the macro window below. Type anything you want in there
> (like /loc or /shout I am bringing a train of nasties to the Zone, please
> pardon any inconvenience this may cause...) Click the done button. This
new
> "Social" button you have created can then be dropped onto your hot keys
for
> ready reference)
>
> More Thom Tips later (like if you see a Gryphon, run away!)


-----Original Message-----
From: Steve Tountas [mailto:tountass@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 12, 1999 3:07 PM
To: shadowknight@onelist.com
Subject: [shadowknight] [corpse retrieval]


From: Steve Tountas <tountass@...>

This may sound stupid, but how can you make commands like /corpse or /loc
into hotkeys? I have been trying to figure it out since I set up my keys,
but haven't been able to do it. Any help would be appreciated, thanks.

At 11:05 PM 5/11/99 -0500, you wrote:
>Here is a handy tip for those of you who die in line of sight of KOS NPC's.
I >discovered this with my druid character who can cast camo. Get someone
to cast >invis or camo on you. Make the /corpse command a hotkey. Get near
your corpse >and drag it along to a safe spot in the zone by contiually
clicking the hotkey >with your mouse. Your invis will not wear off until
you right click on your >corpse.
